thread.title: Is it serious? Mets' Yoenis Cespedes leaves game after getting hit by pitch - NJ.com
thread.title_full: Is it serious? Mets' Yoenis Cespedes leaves game after getting hit by pitch - NJ.com

title: Is it serious? Mets' Yoenis Cespedes leaves game after getting hit by pitch - NJ.com
text:
Comments 
PHILADELPHIA â€” The Mets may have an issue. 
Yoenis Cespedes left the game Wednesday night after he took an 89 mph fastball to his left wrist/hand area from the Phillies' Justin De Fratus. RELATED: Mets' Steven Matz isn't pitching at all now, still injured 
Cespedes dropped down to one knee and was slow to get up. Mets trainer Ray Ramirez quickly came out to check on him, as did manager Terry Collins. Cespedes ultimately walked off into the Mets dugout and was taken out of the game. 
The severity of the injury is not yet known but it would obviously be a dramatic blow to the Mets if it is serious. He entered the night hitting .287 with 17 home runs and a .940 OPS for the Mets in 53 games since they got him at the trade deadline. 
In that time, the Mets catapulted themselves to a National League East title. 
"You thought it was going to be easy after we clinched," Collins said Wednesday afternoon. "Didn't you? 
He didn't know how right he was. The Mets also said Wednesday that Steven Matz was scratched from his start Thursday due to lingering back stiffness.
